abstract.text: A standard control that can initiate the refreshing of a scroll view’s contents.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object is a standard control that you attach to any

object, including table views and collection views. Add this control to scrollable views to give your users a standard way to refresh their contents. When the user drags the top of the scrollable content area downward, the scroll view reveals the refresh control, begins animating its progress indicator, and notifies your app. You use that notification to update your content and dismiss the refresh control.
The refresh control lets you know when to update your content using the target-action mechanism of
. Upon activation, the refresh control calls the action method you provided at configuration time. When adding your action method, configure it to listen for the
event, as shown in the following example code. Use your action method to update your content, and call the refresh control’s

code: // Add the refresh control to your UIScrollView object.

inlineContent.text: . Then associate a target and action method for the
event to manage the refresh behavior of the associated table view.
isn’t available when the user interface idiom is
. However, you can update your app to provide similar functionality in the Mac idiom. For example, replace the control with a Refresh menu item by creating a
object with the title “Refresh” and the keyboard shortcut Command-R. Then add the command to your app’s menu system. For more information, see

The base class for controls, which are visual elements that convey a specific action or intention in response to user interactions.

Tells the control that a refresh operation was started programmatically.
Tells the control that a refresh operation has ended.

The tint color for the refresh control.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.

Defines constants that represent the styles of the scroll indicators.

Displays the scroll indicators momentarily.
